metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23169 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
A heap-buffer overflow was found in the copyIntoFrameBuffer function of OpenEXR in versions before 3.0.1. An attacker could use this flaw to execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the application compiled against OpenEXR.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-23169` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr25 - 2.5.4-2
openexr - 2.5.4-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> it looks like the fix for this issue actually went into the exrcheck tool used by the fuzzer

criterions.comment: openexr package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.4-2').
